strapiPost.title: Nightmare On Block St. Is Back And Bigger Than Ever
strapiPost.content:
Pinpoint Fayetteville is closed this week in order to prepare its space for a month-long, Halloween spooktacular - Nightmare on Block Street. 

  • Meet the Count: Bo Counts, owner of Pinpoint, has always gone big for Halloween in Fayetteville, and this year, the party will span multiple venues for the entire month of October. 
  • Haunted happenings: In addition to the spooky transformation at Pinpoint, the former Nines Alley space will host a haunted theatre experience, Mount Sequoyah will host screenings of locally produced horror films on Oct 5th and Oct 12th, and Ballet Arkansas of Little Rock will bring their performance of Bram Stokerâ€™s Dracula to the Fayetteville Public Library. 

Find more information about the event HERE.
